data.title: Noam Chomsky - Globalization
data.meta_description: Globalization, historically aimed at international integration, has been narrowly redefined to focus on investor rights, leading to misconceptions
data.text:
Q: What is the core concept of free trade according to Adam Smith?

A: Adam Smith's core concept of free trade involves the free circulation of labor, allowing people to move wherever they want.

Q: How has globalization affected convergence towards a single market and wages?

A: Globalization has led to a decrease in convergence towards a single market and wages, particularly in the past 25 years.

Q: What impact has the breakdown of capital controls had on the economy?

A: The breakdown of capital controls has contributed to heightened speculation, impacting economic growth and stability.

Q: What are some of the negative effects of increased financial volatility and capital flows across borders?

A: Increased financial volatility and capital flows across borders have negatively affected the performance of the international economy over the past 25 years.

Q: How has the militarization of the US-Mexico border post-NAFTA reflected international integration?

A: The militarization of the US-Mexico border post-NAFTA reflects a decrease in international integration.

Q: What were the expected impacts of NAFTA on Mexico's population?

A: NAFTA was expected to benefit a small sector while negatively impacting the majority of the population in Mexico, leading to economic challenges and social unrest.
